pull.title: [Qt, Trivial] misc small trivial pull-requests
pull.body:
See individual commit messages for descriptions.
Likely this is for @theuni :).

events.body: It's more efficient if you file these with @theuni's repository on the trivial-next branch directly: https://github.com/theuni/bitcoin

Yes, please do that.

I'll go ahead and review/pull these (along with some others that are waiting) tomorrow, but submitting them directly to the trivial tree would be much better.

I'm not comfortable pulling these into trivial.
1. The authenticated/secure debate has been hashed out here before and I'm not sure how it ended up.
2. The defaultConfirmTarget mixes a small functional change with a cosmetic one.

Feel free to just take the one commit that matches your Trivial specs :). I didn't want to start a new debate, but recently I've been using the authenticated term when dealing with payment requests and also took that from pull-request discussions, when discussing with others.

> The authenticated/secure debate has been hashed out here before and I'm not sure how it ended up.

"Authenticated" is more apt. "Insecure" is ambiguous.
Agree @cfields that functional changes, even minor ones, should not end up in the trivial branch. That could be very dangerous, even a small change can result in big bugs.
I thought there was consensus for writing bitcoin with a lower case b when we are talking about the currency.

events.message:
[Qt, Trivial] misc minor string changes

- write "Bitcoins" uppercase
- replace secure/insecure for payment requests with
  authenticated/unauthenticated
- change a translatable string for payment request expiry to match another
  existing string to only get ONE resulting string to translate
[Qt, Trivial] fix header groupings + space, intdentation fixes
[Qt, Trivial] remove two unneeded includes of wallet/db.h
